page.title: 19 INTERESTING PEOPLE
page.content: Mrs. Joan Scott lives at 6 Orchard Drive,Hambleton.She has worked for the Royal Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals for 20 years on a voluntary basis.At the moment she is caring for a large white rabbit,some cats and a baby Kestrel.A man in Thorpe Willoughby was gardening,when the kestrel landed on his head,he walked inside with it still there,and got in touch with Mrs.Scott.We saw Mr.Scott feeding it rabbit meat.The rarest animals she has looked after are a fox,ferrets and a Pyrennian Mountain Dog.These were also the most interesting cases.She enjoys her job very much even though she is paid nothing but she has won 2 awards,one was worth Â£1000 with this money she has built a well equipped cattery.
